intro: Antidaphne fendleri var. pseudoviscoidea, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments and has a slow growth rate. Its latex contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful if ingested.
